senses.de: The state or action of touching something
senses.ex: She avoided contact with others to prevent spread of germs.

Tips.title: Sensory Perception
Tips.description: Used to describe how something feels when touched, often literally but can be emotional.
Tips.example: The brief contact of their hands was electrifying.

Tips.title: Safety Concern
Tips.description: Highlights the need for caution to avoid illness or physical harm.
Tips.example: Avoid contact with the hot surface.

senses.de: A person who can give help or information
senses.ex: I have a contact in the police department who can help us.

Tips.title: Resourceful Person
Tips.description: Refers to someone useful for assistance or to access specific information.
Tips.example: Please reach out to my contact for insider details.

Tips.title: Networking Necessity
Tips.description: Important for building professional relationships and opportunities.
Tips.example: He leveraged his contacts to advance his career.

senses.de: To communicate with someone, usually through some medium like telephone or email
senses.ex: If you have any questions, don't hesitate to contact me.

Tips.title: Initiate Communication
Tips.description: To start a conversation or request information from someone.
Tips.example: Contact the customer support for further help.

Tips.title: Means of Interaction
Tips.description: Describes the method chosen to communicate, like email, call, or text.
Tips.example: I will contact you via email shortly.

senses.de: The point at which two things meet
senses.ex: The points of contact between the two gears are important for their function.

Tips.title: Mechanical Relevance
Tips.description: Used in mechanics and engineering to explain how parts connect and work together.
Tips.example: The machine malfunctioned due to poor contact points.

Tips.title: Electrical Connection
Tips.description: Refers to an electrical circuit's components coming together to complete a path.
Tips.example: Check the battery contacts for corrosion.

senses.de: A small plastic or glass lens worn in the eye to correct vision
senses.ex: She usually wears glasses, but for special occasions she uses contact lenses.

Tips.title: Vision Correction
Tips.description: Specifically relates to the use of lenses to improve eyesight.
Tips.example: He prefers contacts over glasses for convenience.

Tips.title: Alternative to Glasses
Tips.description: Implies a choice for correcting vision discreetly without spectacles.
Tips.example: Contacts are great for sports activities.

Communicate.wordDefinition:
Communicate means to exchange information or ideas with someone.

For example: "I need to communicate with my boss about my work schedule."

Communicate is used when you want to express your thoughts or ideas, while contact is used when you want to reach out to someone for a specific purpose.

Connection.wordDefinition:
Connection refers to the relationship or link between two things or people. It relates to the strength of the bond between them.

For example, "I feel a strong connection with my best friend."

Connection can also refer to a physical joining of objects, like a cable connecting a computer to the internet.

Connection emphasizes the strength of the relationship between two things while contact emphasizes the act of communication or interaction between them.

Interaction.wordDefinition:
Interaction refers to when two things have a relationship or impact on each other. For example, if you have a conversation with someone on the phone, you are not only making contact with them but also interacting with them.

Contact refers to a physical or verbal connection, while interaction refers to a relationship or effect on each other.

Both words can be used in social situations, but contact is more limited to physical touch or communication, while interaction encompasses a wider range of relationships or exchanges.

Interface.wordDefinition:
Interface generally refers to the point where two separate systems or technologies come together and interact with each other, typically through a software program or device.

For example, a computer's user interface allows the user to interact with the computer system through a keyboard, mouse or touchscreen.

Contact describes physical or communicative connections between people or objects, while interface typically refers to the interaction between technology systems or devices.

Link.wordDefinition:
Link usually refers to a connection between things, such as two websites or two parts of a chain. For example, you might say that you have "linked" two websites together by adding a hyperlink.

Contact is used when referring to a communication with a person, while link is used when referring to a connection between things.

Meet.wordDefinition:
Contact generally means to communicate with someone through phone, email, or any other means of communication without necessarily meeting them in person.

Meet means coming together with someone in person for an interaction.

For example, If you want to contact your friend, you might send them a text message or call them on the phone. But if you want to meet them, you would plan to physically see them face-to-face, like going to the mall with them.

Contact refers to transferring or exchanging information through communication channels while meet means to come together and interact with a person in person.

Reach.wordDefinition:
Reach refers to making contact with someone or something that is not directly accessible or nearby. It is applicable when you want to connect with someone who is not in your immediate area or contact a company that is not easily accessible.

For example, if you want to reach out to a celebrity for an interview, you would use the word reach, as you are not able to directly contact them.

Touch.wordDefinition:
Touch specifically refers to physical contact where one object or person makes physical contact with another object or person, like hugging someone or petting a dog.

Contact can refer to both physical and non-physical connections, whereas touch specifically refers to physical contact.

quotes.Text: I have been listening to the Stooges' self-titled first album for well over half my life, and it remains one of the most exciting and essential records I have ever had the good fortune to come into contact with.
quotes.Title: American Musician
quotes.Name: Henry Rollins

quotes.Text: Basketball is my passion, I love it. But my family and friends mean everything to me. That's what's important. I need my phone so I can keep in contact with them at all times.
quotes.Title: American Basketball Player
quotes.Name: LeBron James

quotes.Text: Words, words, words! They shut one off from the universe. Three quarters of the time one's never in contact with things, only with the beastly words that stand for them.
quotes.Title: English Novelist
quotes.Name: Aldous Huxley

quotes.Text: All of the successes achieved throughout my career and contacts with the fans have made me aware of my responsibility to act as an example in the world of football.
quotes.Title: Portuguese Footballer
quotes.Name: Eusebio

quotes.Text: Some of the most lasting contacts and friendships that I have developed began by just grabbing a drink or breaking bread with a stranger at an industry event.
quotes.Title: American Businessman
quotes.Name: Jay Samit

quotes.Text: I'd really like to be in closer contact with life. I'm a little too distant, I guess. I like to place myself outside.
quotes.Title: French Designer
quotes.Name: Yves Saint Laurent

quotes.Text: I'm old fashioned with my cell phone. I like that human contact and I think it's important.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Giovanni Ribisi

quotes.Text: I think it's very important to have contact with the players that I will coach.
quotes.Title: Argentinian Coach
quotes.Name: Gerardo Martino

quotes.Text: It's very important for Taiwan to maintain its international contact.
quotes.Title: Politician
quotes.Name: Ma Ying-jeou

quotes.Text: I've always been someone who said that football is a contact sport.
quotes.Title: Croatian Athlete
quotes.Name: Niko Kovac
